snippet: In a statement on a proposed United Nations declaration to condemn violence against women, the Brotherhood issued a list of objections, which formally laid out its views on women.
abstract: Muslim Brotherhood formally lays out its deeply patriarchal views on women, stirring fears among Egyptian liberals with its objections to proposed United Nations declaration to condemn violence against women; stance is awkward for Pres Mohamed Morsi, who is trying to present himself as moderate, Western-friendly Islamist.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: In a statement on a proposed United Nations declaration to condemn violence against women, the Brotherhood issued a list of objections, which formally laid out its views on women.

headline.seo: Muslim Brotherhood’s Words on Women Stir Liberal Fears
headline.main: Muslim Brotherhood’s Statement on Women Stirs Liberals’ Fears
headline.print_headline: Muslim Brotherhood’s Statement on Women Stirs Liberals’ Fears
